data.shownotes: Cellophane contained I'm In Your Mind and I'm Not In Your Mind teases. Am I In Heaven? was played for the first time since 2016-05-14. (70 show gap) KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Billabong Valley and Rattlesnake were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed through the written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. All songs aside from Anoxia, Invisible Face and Gamma Knife through Am I In Heaven? were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

All Is Known was introduced as a new song and contained alternate lyrics. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Open Water through Rattlesnake were confirmed by the band's Facebook livestream and the Altered Beast suite was confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

Crosstown Traffic (The Jimi Hendrix Experience) played before and as the band walked on stage for the second set. The Altered Beast suite and The Balrog were introduced as new songs. Before Alter Me I, the band took a moment to fix loud buzzing coming from Ambrose's equipment. Invisible Face was incomplete. Am I In Heaven? contained Alter Me and Cellophane teases and quotes, Rattlesnake, Hot Water, and Head On/Pill teases, and a Sea Of Trees jam with lyrics. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Alter Me I through Am I In Heaven? were confirmed by the band's Facebook livestream. The remaining songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

High Voltage (AC/DC) played before and as the band walked on stage for the first set. All Is Known was introduced as a new song and contained alternate lyrics. During Billabong Valley, the guitar strap fell off the Flying Microtonal Banana while Ambrose was using it, with Joey jokingly telling Stu afterwards that his guitar was broken and that Ambrose should "stick to the blues harp". NOBODY'S BABY (Sheer Mag) played before and as the band walked on stage for the second set. Before Gamma Knife, the crowd started chanting for Stu to do a "shoey", to which he told them to "be reasonable" and that he was "too old for that". The Balrog was introduced as a new song. Am I In Heaven? contained a medley of teases and quotes including Alter Me, Cellophane, Rattlesnake, Hot Water, Head On/Pill and The River as well as a Sea of Trees jam with lyrics. This performance was filmed in 360-degree video and released as "King Gizzard & The Lizard Wizard - 360° Full Concert" on the Banalarama YouTube channel, featuring audio mixed by Stu
Webcast live by Pitchfork. Night one was performed in the grand ballroom.
Sea Of Trees was played for the first time known since 2014-10-24. (217 show gap)

This show featured the debut of Vomit Coffin. Following Rattlesnake, the band wished a happy birthday to Eric. Am I In Heaven? contained teases and quotes of Cellophane, The River, Head On/Pill, I'm In Your Mind, Sea of Trees, Rattlesnake, and Robot Stop. Prior to the show, Stu accidentally posted a link containing demos for all of Polygondwanaland to the Facebook fan page under the name “Blinky Bill”. Although removed shortly after, someone was able to download the first two demos causing Stu to message them claiming he was a fan named Han-Tyumi and asked for the demos not to be reposted. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but no recordings are available. KGLW.net staff believes the setlist is complete based on contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but no recordings are available. KGLW.net staff believes the setlist is complete based on contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

data.venuename: Paradise Pool at Hard Rock Hotel

data.showtitle: Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival

data.shownotes: During final song Stu crowd surfed out of the venue and into the sea, while the band continued to play.
Poster by Olya Dyer, limited to 100

This show featured the debuts of Greenhouse Heat Death, D-Day, The Book, Polygondwanaland, and The Fourth Colour. The vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion was not performed. All Is Known was played for the first time since 2018-02-18. (69 show gap) Doom City contained a Crumbling Castle outro. Evil Death Roll was played for the first time since 2017-06-06. (50 show gap) Big Fig Wasp was played for the first time since 2016-09-22. (100 show gap)

The Coffee Cola Song (Francis Bebey) played as the band came on stage. At the start of the show, Joey says this is "the biggest show we've ever played". Before Nuclear Fusion, Joey said that he had said he wasn't going to do the vocal intro anymore, but that he'd "do it tonight". He jokingly apologized to Sam after the vocal intro. The Book was instrumental. Doom City contained a Crumbling Castle outro. Sister Ray (The Velvet Underground) was played over the PA as the setbreak music with a 15 minute countdown on the screen. Han-Tyumi, The Confused Cyborg contained alternate lyrics and Stu on flute. Robot Stop contained a Hot Water tease.

Poster by Olya Dyer limited to 100 prints KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Big Fig Wasp was confirmed through video recording. The rest of the songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This was the band's first show in Ireland, and took place at the historic Olympia Theatre (later known as 3Olympia Theatre for sponsorship purposes). The band was supported by Mild High Club. Alex Brettin from Mild High Club sat in during King Gizzard's set for D-Day and The Book. God Is In The Rhythm was played for the first time known since 2015-06-24. (241 show gap)

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is incomplete, Anoxia, D-Day and Sleep Drifter are confirmed by video. If anyone has any additional information on what was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.
I'm In Your Mind was played for the first time since 2017-01-21. (133 shows) Alter Me II was played for the first time since 2017-12-02. (50 show gap)

Am I In Heaven? contained Alter Me I, Robot Stop, Cellophane, Rattlesnake and Head On/Pill teases and quotes. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings are available. Cyboogie, This Thing and The Cruel Millennial have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the physical written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band went on stage. Work This Time contained a guitar solo for the first time. The Bitter Boogie contained Cyboogie teases and Boogieman Sam quotes. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Planet B through The Fourth Colour, Work This Time, Let Me Mend The Past and Self-Immolate through The Bitter Boogie were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 200

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. The Balrog and The Bitter Boogie were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers as the band went on stage. Sleep Drifter contained a Honey intro tease. The River contained Wah Wah quotes. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. All songs except Venusian 1 and Anoxia were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers as the band went on stage. Beginner's Luck was introduced as a song about Stu's gambling addiction. After Organ Farmer, Joey thanked openers Stonefield and ORB. Am I In Heaven? contained Mars For The Rich and Venusian 2 teases and Alter Me, Boogieman Sam and Hot Water teases and quotes KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Mars For The Rich, Alter Me I through Anoxia and Tezeta through Am I In Heaven? were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 200

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band went on stage. Alter Me I contained Evil Death Roll teases. The Bitter Boogie contained Cut Throat Boogie and On The Road Again (Canned Heat) quotes. ‘Inner Cell’, ‘Loyalty’, and ‘Horology’ from this show are featured in the ‘Chunky Shrapnel’ album.

Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 400

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band came on stage. After Billabong Valley a kid was invited on stage to hug the band. Am I In Heaven? contained teases and quotes of Pill, Boogieman Sam, and Alter Me. Organ Farmer was on the setlist before Am I in Heaven? but wasn't played. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as Live in Paris ‘19. Poster by Jason Galea Edition of 200

This show featured the live debuts of Fury, Some of Us, and O.N.E. Nuclear Fusion did not include the vocal intro, though Joey initially indicated that he was going to have Cavs do it. E. Bobby G. and Leah Senior were shouted out after Static Electricity. Pleura was stopped midway through due to sound issues with the band’s monitors and Joey joked that they were going to make a concept album out of the “fart noises” that only they could hear. The song was then resumed from where they left off. Straws in the Wind was dedicated to Hayden Green. Billabong Valley contained Sleep Drifter and Nuclear Fusion teases. Rattlesnake contained Nuclear Fusion teases. The Reticent Raconteur and The Lord of Lightning featured narration by Leah Senior.

Nuclear Fusion did not include the throat singing intro. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings exist. KGLW.net staff was only able to confirm KGLW (Intro), Doom City, Straws in the Wind, Nuclear Fusion, Honey and K.G.L.W. (Outro) through audio or video recordings. Despite the incomplete recordings, KGLW.net staff believes the setlist is complete based on contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that requires audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

As requested by Joey, Ambrose provided the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion. Straws in the Wind contained Nuclear Fusion teases. The Book featured a Cavs drum solo. Before Supreme Ascendency, Joey remarked that the crowd and venue reminded him of The Great Gatsby. Tropical Fuck Storm was shouted out before The Hungry Wolf of Fate. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as Live in Sydney '21.

This was the Microtonal Night show of the Princess Theatre residency, the third of five planned shows, each featuring a different specific genre and preannounced songs. The Book featured a drum solo by Cavs. Doom City was introduced as a song about planet Earth. Billabong Valley featured guest vocals by Grace Cummings. Rattlesnake contained teases of Sleep Drifter, Honey, O.N.E., Nuclear Fusion and Billabong Valley. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings exist. Recordings of K.G.L.W. (Intro) and Automation are unavailable and several other songs are incomplete. The missing songs were confirmed based on the preannounced song lists for each of the 5 planned genre specific shows and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 200

Head On/Pill featured Ambrose on sax and Stu playing flute, as well as Hot Water and The Dripping Tap teases and Iron Lung quotes. Rattlesnake contained Doom City teases and O.N.E. and Automation teases and quotes. Am I In Heaven? contained Head On/Pill and The Dripping Tap teases and quotes, as well as The Grim Reaper quotes. During Am I In Heaven?, a cake and flowers was brought out for Cookie's birthday, and both were thrown into the crowd soon after. Self-Immolate and Organ Farmer were on the written setlist after Rattlesnake but were cut. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Head On/Pill, The Garden Goblin, Rattlesnake, and Am I In Heaven? have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the physical written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

The show opened with a brief drum solo by Cavs prior to the rest of the band taking the stage. History owner (Drake) (“Champagne Papi”) was mentioned a number of times over the course of the show. Rattlesnake contained O.N.E. and Automation quotes and teases. Ambrose crowd surfed while singing the refrain in Straws in the Wind. Joey introduced Anoxia as “my Neil Young impersonation song.” Ice V was introduced as being “in memory of Queen E.” Prior to Digital Black, Joey said "hello" numerous times in a Han-Tyumi impression. Soy-Protein Munt Machine and Vomit Coffin contained Hypertension teases. The Dripping Tap contained an I’m in Your Mind Fuzz Suite tease. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The recordings of this show are incomplete (missing Digital Black). KGLW.net staff do have enough to confirm the > into Han-Tyumi and that Ice V came to a full stop. For the show opening drum solo, it was discussed whether this should be added to the setlist as “Fury” in order to match with the show opening drum solo from the Melbourne ‘21 bootlegger release. It was decided that the drum solos labeled “Fury” by the band consist of a distinct double bass drum part which is absent from this drum solo and that other drum solos have been given different names (i.e. “Parking” on Chunky Shrapnel), therefore it was decided to leave this drum solo as a show note since we do not have definitive information on what it should be called. If anyone has any further information about these items, or ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Carlo Vivary

Anoxia was played for the first time since October 18, 2022 (52 show gap). Her and I contained Magenta Mountain and Blindness (The Fall) teases. After the song, Ambrose quotes Walk The Dinosaur (Was (Not Was)). Evil Death Roll contained Witchcraft and Converge teases. Wah Wah contained The River quotes. Only Parts I, II, and III of The River were performer and they contained Her and I (Slow Jam 2), Am I In Heaven?, and Hell's Itch teases. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a Dragon jam. Poster By Jason Galea 420 Standard / 120 Foil

This show featured the debut of Dragon. Am I In Heaven? contained teases of Hot Water and Witchcraft.

Poster By Elora Sperber

Anoxia was last played 2023-08-16. (57 show gap) The beginning of Billabong Valley contained Cotton-Eyed Joe (Traditional) quotes and an Automation tease. Tetrachromacy was last played 2022-10-14 (119 show gap). It's Got Old was last played 2023-06-04 (73 show gap). Before Mystery Jack, Zebra (John Butler) was teased. Dirt was last played 2022-04-13 (169 show gap), and contained a Hot Water tease. Following the Mirage City Reprise, the band teased and quoted We Will Rock You (Queen) with the lyrics changed to "We will Red Rock you". Field of Vision was dedicated to tour manager Jess Lewis. Tetrachromacy through Work This Time featured Joey on acoustic guitar. Rats In The Sky contained a Hot Water tease. Hot Water contained Nutbush City Limits (Ike & Tina Turner), Antarctica, Motor Spirit, and Iron Lung quotes, and Hell's Riff. Ambrose quoted If You Want My Love (Cheap Trick) as the band left the stage. Following the show those attending both the early and late shows were allowed to stay in the venue and Pipe-eye's upcoming album Pipe-defy and Heavy Moss' upcoming album Dead Slow were played over the PA.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard - 1200
Gold Foil - 300

This show featured the debut of Smoke & Mirrors. The Dripping Tap contained a Chang'e and Head On/Pill tease and an Antarctica vocal tease. Before Flight b741, the band talked about the clouds at the venue, and Joey quoted Field of Vision, and Stu referenced The Land Before Time. Intrasport was played without the synth table. Sense was played in an alternate synth version for the first time. During Grim Reaper, which contained "Black Market Bargain" lyrics and Get Low (Lil Jon) and H.O.O.D. (Kneecap) quotes. Amby called out, "are you not entertained?" in reference to Gladiator. Only Ambrose's verses of Smoke & Mirrors were performed, and the song contained The Grim Reaper teases. Gaia and Gila Monster ended in a drum solos. Before Inner Cell, Stu teased Loyalty.
